Text:

it works dude, make sure to follow installation steps ;)

Then run the tool again, as Administrator.

I confirm the comment of "frittemich".
I disabled self defense, but got the message "self defense is enabled..."

Would it work with Wn 7 ?? Despite having turned of Avast Self Defence, it reports that Self Defence is on.  I Have WIn 7 64bit, Latest Avast internet Security trial. But thanks for your rest of uploads.

Thank you!

You open the Avast cent,
settings,
Troubleshooting == >> avast! == >> Enable Disable self defense module,
Create a Notepad == >> ((fake) Fake!)) version.dll file, which is
c:  Program Files  AVAST Software  Avast  folder to,
or wherever you have installed the avast.
(Content can be anything, or nothing, of no significance, because in the future they can be overwritten)
Having done that run the Avast Activator.exe in 2050, right-click Administrator.
If you restart the computer to activate already been implemented,

Magnyitod Avast cent,
settings,
Troubleshooting == >> avast! == >> Enable self-protection module On
can u explain in detail how to create a fake dll file ?? im confused :(
can u explain in detail how to create a fake dll .. im confused :( i cant get it to work ..

1.Launch avast user interface and then go to
settings>troubleshooting>Disable self defense module,
2.Create an empty notepad save it as version.dll file, in c:Program Files/AVAST Software/Avast
or wherever you have installed the avast.
3. Run Avast Activator.exe in 2050 as administrator and activate.
4. Restart and then connect to the internet and activate the license.

credit to cinus76

THIS ACTIVATOR JUST WORKED LIKE A CHARM IN WINDOWS7
that's all
